text: Thomas John Mitchell (July 11, 1892 â€“ December 17, 1962) was an American actor and writer. He played Gerald O'Hara in Gone with the Wind, Doc Boone in Stagecoach, Uncle Billy in It's a Wonderful Life, Pat Garrett in The Outlaw, and Mayor Jonas Henderson in High Noon. Mitchell was the first male actor to win the Triple Crown of Acting by winning an Oscar, an Emmy, and a Tony Award. ==References== Category:1892 births Category:1962 deaths Category:Deaths from mesothelioma Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American radio actors Category:Actors from New Jersey Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:American Academy Award winning actors Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Tony Award winning actors
title: Thomas Mitchell (actor)
